Member Function Documentation

void chaos::str::UTF8String::assign ( const char *  data)

Assigns the internal data of this UTF8String to the given string literal.

This operation will delete any current internal data of this object. The input data is expected to be utf-8 encoded and NULL terminated.

Parameters
dataData buffer to copy from.
void chaos::str::UTF8String::assign ( const char *  data,
size_t  length 
)

Assigns the internal data of this UTF8String to the given string literal.

This operation will delete any current internal data of this object. The input data is expected to be utf-8 encoded. This function should be used when the input data is not NULL terminated, or can be used for optimisation purposes if the length of data is already known. This will mean the length of the data will not need to be evaluated internally.

Parameters
dataData buffer to copy from.
lengthNumber of bytes in the provided data buffer.
void chaos::str::UTF8String::assign ( const chaos::int8 *  data)

Assigns the internal data of this UTF8String to the given data buffer.

This operation will delete any current internal data of this object. The input data is expected to be utf-8 encoded and NULL terminated.

Parameters
dataData buffer to copy from.
void chaos::str::UTF8String::assign ( const chaos::int8 *  data,
size_t  length 
)

Assigns the internal data of this UTF8String to the given data buffer.

This operation will delete any current internal data of this object. The input data is expected to be utf-8 encoded. This function should be used when the input data is not NULL terminated, or can be used for optimisation purposes if the length of data is already known. This will mean the length of the data will not need to be evaluated internally.

Parameters
dataData buffer to copy from.
lengthNumber of bytes in the provided data buffer.
void chaos::str::UTF8String::assign ( const UTF8String &  other)

Assigns internal data from another UTF8String.

Assigns the internal of data this UTF8String as a copy from the internal data of the provided UTF8String.

Parameters
otherUTF8String to copy internal data from.
const UTF8String& chaos::str::UTF8String::concatenate ( const UTF8String &  other)

Applies formating to this UTF8String by replacing formatting tokens in the string with the provided arguments.

This works the same as sprintf does for c strings. Example usage:

chaos::str::UTF8String s( "Hello %d World %d" );
s.format( 0, 75 );
// prints "Hello 0 World 75"
std::cout << s << std::endl;
Returns
Reference to this UTF8String after the format has taken place.

Concatenates another UTF8String on to the end of this string.

UTF8String to append to the end of this string.

Returns
A reference to this UTF8String after the concatenation has taken place.
size_t chaos::str::UTF8String::findFirst ( const UTF8String &  substring) const

Finds the first occurrence of the given substring and returns the index of it.

Parameters
substringUTF8String to find the first occurrence of in this string.
Returns
The index of the beginning of the first occurrence of the substring in this string. If the substring could not be found, chaos::str::UTF8String::npos is returned instead.
size_t chaos::str::UTF8String::findLast ( const UTF8String &  substring) const

Finds the last occurrence of the given substring and returns the index of it.

Parameters
substringUTF8String to find the last occurrence of in this string.
Returns
The index of the beginning of the last occurrence of the substring in this string. If the substring could not be found, chaos::str::UTF8String::npos is returned instead.
size_t chaos::str::UTF8String::getByteLength ( ) const

Get the length of the internal buffer data in bytes.

This is exactly the number of bytes in the internal raw data of this UTF8String which can be accessed through getRawData(). Note that this data is NULL ('\0') terminated and this length includes the NULL terminator. Therefore if UTF8String == "" then getByteLength() == 1.

Note
This is not equal to the character length of the string as utf-8 encoded characters can take up multiple bytes.
Returns
The length of the internal data.
const char* chaos::str::UTF8String::getCString ( ) const

Gets the raw byte data of this UTF8String as c style string (const char*).

This function is the same as getRawData() except the data is casted to const char*.

Returns
a pointer to the c style string representation of the data.
size_t chaos::str::UTF8String::getLength ( ) const

/brief Return the length of this UTF8String

The length is defined how many utf-8 symbols there are in the string, this length doesn't not necessarily equal the byte length of the string.

Returns
The number of utf-8 symbols in this UTF8String.
const chaos::int8* chaos::str::UTF8String::getRawData ( ) const

Get the raw byte data of this UTF8String.

Returns
a pointer to a constant representation of the internal data.

UTF8String chaos::str::UTF8String::operator+ ( const UTF8String &  other) const

Addition operator.

Performs the same function as concatenate() but does not cause any modifications to this string, instead returns a new string which contains the results of the concatenation.

Parameters
otherUTF8String to append to the end of a copy of this string.
Returns
UTF8String that contains the results of the concatenation.
const UTF8String& chaos::str::UTF8String::operator+= ( const UTF8String &  other)

Compound addition operator.

Performs the same function as concatenate().

UTF8String to append to the end of this string.

Returns
A reference to this UTF8String after the concatenation has taken place.
bool chaos::str::UTF8String::operator< ( const UTF8String &  other) const

Less than operator.

Compares whether this UTF8String is less than the other given UTF8String.

Less than is defined by performing a value comparison between each Unicode code point in the string.

Warning
correct implementation in progress
Parameters
otherUTF8String to compare against.
Returns
Whether this UTF8String is less than the other.

Is the same as calling assign( const UTF8String& ).

size_t  length 
) const

Returns a UTF8String composed of a substring of this string.

Parameters
startIndex of the symbol to start the substring from.
lengththe length of the substring. If greater than the possible symbols to allocate it will be clamped to the maximum length of the substring.
Returns
new UTF8String containing the substring.
